thread.title: Bizarre inning in Rangers-Blue Jays game ignites fans in stands, on Twitter
thread.title_full: Bizarre inning in Rangers-Blue Jays game ignites fans in stands, on Twitter - San Antonio Express-News

author: Nick Moyle
title: Bizarre inning in Rangers-Blue Jays game ignites fans in stands, on Twitter
text:
Photo: Nick Moyle, Twitter.com Image 1 of / 13 13 Photo: Nick Moyle, Twitter.com Image 2 of 13 Photo: Nick Moyle, Twitter.com Image 3 of 13 Photo: Nick Moyle, Twitter.com Image 4 of 13 Photo: Nick Moyle, Twitter.com Image 5 of 13 Photo: Nick Moyle, Twitter.com Image 6 of 13 Photo: Nick Moyle, Twitter.com Image 7 of 13 Photo: Nick Moyle, Twitter.com Image 8 of 13 Photo: Nick Moyle, Twitter.com Image 9 of 13 Photo: Nick Moyle, Twitter.com Image 10 of 13 Photo: Nick Moyle, Twitter.com Image 11 of 13 Photo: Nick Moyle, Twitter.com\ Image 12 of 13 Photo: Nick Moyle, Twitter.com Image 13 of 13 Bizarre inning in Rangers-Blue Jays game ignites fans in stands, on Twitter 1 / 13 Back to Gallery A routine throw from Blue Jays catcher Russell Martin back to Aaron Sanchez at the pitcher's mound began what would become one of the most bizarre innings in postseason history.
Martin's throw ricocheted off the bat of Shin-Soo Choo and rolled towards third base, where Rougned Odor was standing. Odor streaked home and crossed the plate as the rest of the Blue Jays — and their fans — looked on in utter confusion.
After a lengthy replay review and torrent of fan-thrown garbage delayed the game, umpires ruled the run would stand, giving the Rangers 3-2 lead in the top of the 7th.
RELATED: Rangers-Blue Jays 14-inning game historic
Fans demanded swift retribution as many were escorted out by security following the hail of debris they reigned down upon the field.
In this case, it appears Karma was swift.
The bottom of the seventh saw the Rangers commit three consecutive errors, and before rage could grip all of Canada, Jose Bautista cranked one into the obstreperous stands.
Just like that the Blue Jays were back up 6-3 heading into the eighth.
In the span of an inning, emotions from Rangers and Blue Jays fans touched every portion of the spectrum. Here's a look at some of the best reactions to what may be remembered as one of the most chaotic series of events ever witnessed in a postseason baseball game.
Click through the slides above to see the best and worst of social media's reactions.
